qas.question: In what year was Kitab al-Miraj likely translated into Latin?
Which works by Shakespeare is believed to be inspired by The Moors?

answers.text: Merchant of Venice, Titus Andronicus and Othello

qas.question: In what century is it believed that delegations of Moors began to influence western works by the likes of Shakespeare?
What aspects from Islamic works did the Divine Comedy feature?

answers.text: episodes about Bolgia from Arabic works on Islamic eschatology

qas.question: What was translated to Latin in the 12th century?
Who visited Elizabethan England in the 1700's?

context: <a1_0>Dante Alighieri<a1_0/>'s Divine Comedy, derived features of and <a4_0>episodes about Bolgia from Arabic works on Islamic eschatology<a4_0/>: the Hadith and the <b5_0>Kitab al-Miraj<b5_0/> (translated into Latin <a0_0>in 1264 or shortly before<a0_0/> as Liber Scale Machometi) concerning the ascension to Heaven of Muhammad, and the spiritual writings of Ibn Arabi. The Moors also had a noticeable influence on the works of <b6_0><b8_0>George Peele and William Shakespeare<b8_0/><b6_0/>. Some of their works featured Moorish characters, such as Peele's The Battle of Alcazar and Shakespeare's The <a2_0>Merchant of Venice, Titus Andronicus and Othello<a2_0/>, which featured a Moorish Othello as its title character. These works are said to have been inspired by <b7_0>several Moorish delegations from Morocco<b7_0/> to Elizabethan England at the beginning of the <a3_0>17th century<a3_0/>.
